intro: Picralima klaineana, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with prominent centers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the flowers are borne on long, erect stems. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forest understories or along streambanks.
